link.title: Hi, great to have all the info in one place, thank you! If I was planning to take on the...

entry.summary: Hi, great to have all the info in one place, thank you! If I was planning to take on the...
entry.content:
Hi, great to have all the info in one place, thank you!
If I was planning to take on the beer mile with a largeish group of friends (maybe 20 people, for a birthday celebration) would we be able to just turn up and pick and choose which bars to go in, or will we need to book?
Thank you!

entry.title: Christopher Robertson commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'

link.title: Hey! Just a small update from Cloudwater, we are open inside again now for table service only, Wednesday through to...

entry.summary: Hey! Just a small update from Cloudwater, we are open inside again now for table service only, Wednesday through to...
entry.content:
Hey! Just a small update from Cloudwater, we are open inside again now for table service only, Wednesday through to Sunday. From the 1st of Novemeber our opening hours will be:
Monday/Tuesday: Closed
Wednesday/Thursday: 16:00 - 21:00
Friday: 16:00 - 22:00
Saturday: 12:00 - 22:00
Sunday: 12:00 - 20:00

entry.content: Is it safe to assume that on Saturday the 24th of July, the first weekend since all restrictions being eased, all venues will no longer need bookings?

entry.title: SpankTM commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'

link.title: Huw - That's a tricky one at the moment - most of the bars are largely operating on the street,...

entry.summary: Huw - That's a tricky one at the moment - most of the bars are largely operating on the street,...
entry.content: Huw - That's a tricky one at the moment - most of the bars are largely operating on the street, with not much going on in the indoor space where you'd normally keep a telly. Based on our trip there last weekend, the only one we saw that had the football on was Craft Beer Junction. (You can see it in the picture on https://www.bermondsey-beer-mile.co.uk/craft-beer-junction.html if you squint really hard.)

entry.content: Affinity has been replaced by The Outpost Brewery and Taproom (a Three Hills Brewing Project). They opened the taproom a week ago and they have an interesting beer range (including a peach melba fruited sour) as well as some guest beers.

link.title: Hey, great guide. So I've tentatively started organising my brothers stag do and thought the beer mile would be a...

entry.summary: Hey, great guide. So I've tentatively started organising my brothers stag do and thought the beer mile would be a...
entry.content:
Hey, great guide.

So I've tentatively started organising my brothers stag do and thought the beer mile would be a fun thing to do on it. However after the crap year we've all had im wondering if you've heard any news about when/if theyre all reopening.

The stag do wouldnt be until July so there's plenty of time so fingers crossed. Just wondered if you'd heard any news.

James

entry.title: Cllr Humaira Ali commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'

link.title: I'm a local Councillor and whilst it's fantastic to have loads of businesses in the area, the creation of the...

entry.summary: I'm a local Councillor and whilst it's fantastic to have loads of businesses in the area, the creation of the...
entry.content:
I'm a local Councillor and whilst it's fantastic to have loads of businesses in the area, the creation of the 'beer mile' has given untold stress to local residents. There is increased noise, antisocial behaviour, danger for young children and a broad cumulative impact from some loud and leery revellers. We are working with businesses and the first order will be to rename it away from the beer mile. Whoever is visiting the area, please show the utmost consideration to residents and keep noise to a minimum. You wouldn't want to experience what my residents have to ensure. Residents with PTSD, sensory disorders are now under greater medical supervision.

To those that run this site. Nice idea and helpful but I'd respectfully ask you to rename away from the beer mile. Happy to work with you when this area is rebranded.

entry.summary: Kat - Full maps of the Mile do exist out there - like this one https://www.google.com/maps/d/embed?mid=1qOln6LfuHW_qZWVVvWzA6-rYlHQ&ll=51.498415722518835%2C-0.07049506088253565&z=16 - but our thinking...
entry.content: Kat - Full maps of the Mile do exist out there - like this one https://www.google.com/maps/d/embed?mid=1qOln6LfuHW_qZWVVvWzA6-rYlHQ&ll=51.498415722518835%2C-0.07049506088253565&z=16 - but our thinking was that it's far too big and rapidly-changing nowadays for a single map to cover it sensibly. That's why we've chosen to plot a series of individual maps between one bar and the next - click on the distance figures above to pull those up.

entry.title: SpankTM commented on 'The Bermondsey Beer Mile: An Unofficial Introduction'

link.title: Warren - My guess would be that most of them will be closed - a lot of them don't open...

entry.summary: Warren - My guess would be that most of them will be closed - a lot of them don't open...
entry.content: Warren - My guess would be that most of them will be closed - a lot of them don't open on Mondays anyway, and it wouldn't make much difference whether it was a Bank Holiday or not. Bear in mind a lot of these places are working breweries first, bars second, and they like to take holidays too! Still, each bar is a separate case and will have their own plans. Probably best to check their individual websites and associated social media feeds and see what their plans are.
